conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in School_C.

In general terms, yes—we are still keeping our single remaining seat available for higher-priority students on our list who may apply in later rounds. In particular, some higher-priority students may first pursue other schools and only approach School_C if they are not matched elsewhere, so we cannot reliably rule out additional higher-priority applications at this stage.

As for conditions/timing: we would only be able to extend an offer to you if our seat remains open and no higher-priority candidate is seeking that seat at the time we are making an acceptance decision. Practically, that becomes more likely later in the process if it becomes clear that higher-priority candidates have matched elsewhere or are no longer active.

If you’d like, you may continue to check in periodically; we will respond consistently based on the same priority and capacity constraints.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
